byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by John Koblin, Christine Hauser and Alan Schwarz from New York, Michael S. Schmidt and C. J. Chivers from Washington, and Jim Wilson from San Bernardino.

abstract: Landlord allows dozens of reporters into townhouse he rented to Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik; live television coverage inside house sparks criticism of news media, although law enforcement officers had already scoured premises.
lead_paragraph: The images of journalists going through the belongings of the shooting suspects raised questions about what arrangements had been made with law enforcement officials.

headline.main: Landlord Lets Reporters Into San Bernardino Suspects’ Home
headline.print_headline: Questions and Trepidation as Suspects’ Home Is Opened to Reporters

snippet: The images of journalists going through the belongings of the shooting suspects raised questions about what arrangements had been made with law enforcement officials.
